note.para: Auxiliary countershaft bearings will be installed at this time if replacement was required.

step1.para: Mark each countershaft for correct timing. Locate the "O" stamped on the countershaft and mark the tooth with highly visible toolmaker's dye or paint ( Figure 166).

figure.caption: Figure 166. Mark Each Countershaft For Correct Timing

step1.para: Place the countershafts in a fixture or on a flat surface for reassembly. Locate output shaft assembly between countershafts; timing of the auxiliary will be checked at this time. The single marked tooth of each countershaft must align with the two teeth marked on each side of the LO range gear ( Figure 167).

figure.caption: Figure 167. Locate Output Shaft Assembly Between Countershafts

step1.para: Install the range yoke into the synchronizer sliding clutch slot, offset side facing down ( Figure 168).

figure.caption: Figure 168. Install Range Yoke into Synchronizer Sliding Clutch Slot

step1.para: Place the auxiliary housing over the countershaft assemblies and output shaft assemblies ( Figure 169).

figure.caption: Figure 169. Place Auxiliary Housing Over Countershaft and Output Shaft Assemblies

step1.para: Heat the rear output shaft bearing cone and install the bearing on the shaft taper side down ( Figure 170).

figure.caption: Figure 170. Heat and Install Rear Output Shaft Bearing Cone

note.para: Do not heat the bearing above 275°F (136°C).

step1.para: Install the rear bearing cover on the auxiliary housing ( Figure 171). The nylon collar and brass washer are installed in the chamfered hole on the lower right side of the cover.

figure.caption: Figure 171. Install Rear Bearing Cover on Auxiliary Housing

note.para: Because the collar becomes distorted when compressed, DO NOT RE-USE THE OLD NYLON COLLAR.
